Experiment Method.Assay Method: Phospholipid Binding Assay and Filament Assembly Analysis

Material used.Description: Recombinant alpha-synuclein variants were expressed and purified for analysis.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Increased phospholipid binding and filament assembly rates
Readout description.Result Description: The E46K variant showed significantly higher phospholipid binding affinity and accelerated filament formation compared to wild-type, with a twisted morphology observed under microscopy.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the text.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the text.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type alpha-synuclein was used as a positive control for binding and filament formation.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Standard threshold for phospholipid binding and filament assembly rates based on wild-type controls.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significantly higher binding affinity (e.g., >20% increase) or altered filament morphology compared to wild-type.
